Question: If you have data with a large number of features and you are sure that it will take some time to train and tune the model, which approach is LEAST likely to result in a speed improvement during grid-searching?
Answer: In your pipeline use variance thresholding to limit the number of features
Use the Shuffle and split form of cross-validation
Use a randomized grid search form of cross validation
Use PCA to reduce the dimensionality of the data before training
Correct: Use the Shuffle and split form of cross-validation
